moves.2... Nc6: We are now out of the openings book, but my opponent's move seems fine to me, because it pressures a centre pawn.
moves.3. Nf3: I support d5 with my knight.
moves.3... Nxd4 4. Nxd4 cxd4 5. Qxd4: Should I have brought out my queen this early?
moves.6. Nc3: Is this OK, or is c3 better?
moves.6... b6 7. Qd5: I offer a queen exchange so I can get unopposed control of the centre.
moves.7... b5: ? This gives away a pawn and allows me to re-offer the exchange at the same time.
moves.8. Qxb5 Qc7 9. Nd5: I'm trying to get the queen away from the area of c7 so I can do Nc7+.
moves.9... Qd6 10. Bf4: Black can no longer defend c7 without losing his queen.
moves.11... Kd8 12. Nxa8 e6: I suppose Black is trying to get some control of the centre and develop his DSB.
moves.13. Qa5+: At this point, I decide to try for a mate.
moves.14... d6 15. Qxd6+ Kf6: Ke8 would mean a mate in one by Nc7#.
moves.16... Be7: Blocks the flight square of e7.
moves.18. Qxe5#: Checkmate! Feel free to comment and give constructive criticism.
